item.title: New Data Explorer features
item.description: If you browse data on our Data Explorer, you might notice some new changes. In recent months, we’ve been rolling out a series of modifications and redesigns that, we hope, make it easier for you to browse the data and find what you’re looking for. Here’s what the Data Explorer looks like now: Here are some of the changes we’ve made, and why we’ve made them. Exposing options menus Each of the Data Explorer’s views includes options for how to display the data.

item.title: Advanced site tools
item.description: If you are a data scientist, programmer, open data enthusiast, open source evangelist, data visualiation specialist or somebody who aspires to be any of those, then there are some advanced features of the Environment and Health Data Portal that you can use to get and use our data. Re-use data visualizations The visualizations on our site’s Data Explorer use a JavaScript library called Vega-Lite. Vega-lite provides a few options for you to use the visualizations in other contexts.

item.title: The redesigned EH Data Portal
item.description: The Environment and Health Data Portal looks a little bit different! We recently redesigned our site to make it easier for you to find important data and information on how the environment affects health. Here’s what the new site has to offer: An updated design: The whole site got a fresh design to make exploring easier for you – whether you’re on a desktop computer, a phone, or a tablet. It’s been optimized for accessibility, translation, and clear, simple presentation of information, using the NYC Core Framework, an open-source framework based on Bootstrap.
